channel.title: Online Home of Rajkumar
channel.description: Recent content on Online Home of Rajkumar

item.title: Boredom, Books & Bugs
item.description: With millions of people stuck at home during the COVID-19 crisis, many explored various new hobbies to keep themselves occupied and ensure that they are not unduly stressed. According to a survey by The Healthy Work Company, a workplace mental health consultancy, 22% of respondents had taken up a new pastime in lockdown, while 35% had rediscovered an old one. In this article, I wanted to share my experiences on how I spent the past year locked inside four walls.

item.title: Building a J2EE app using IntelliJ Idea and deploying on Heroku
item.description: Let’s see how to build a basic Java Enterprise (fondly known as J2EE) application, made up of a Servlet and a JSP file, with the help of the popular IDE by Jetbrains, IntelliJ Idea. Finally, we will have a look at how to deploy the same on the Heroku cloud. ðŸŒ§ In the first place, I’m writing this blog because I couldn’t find a full-fledged write-up on how to do this myself initially and I had to try and err to find out the right way to do it.

item.title: Badgie - My first native GTK app
item.description: elementary OS has been my favourite Linux distro for quite a long time because of its beautiful UI, less bloatware which lets me focus on the work that needs to be done. After having used the OS, I wanted to contribute to it in some way or the other. And I started doing so by contributing to a currency converter app called Moneta which is available to download from elementary’s AppCenter.

item.title: Amrita Repository - Suite of Apps
item.description: In my first year of college, during the time of examinations more than 60% of my class used to pester those one or two guys who used to download the previous year question papers for reference from an intranet site (which still remains a mystery to most of the students). Being a hard-core techie, I wanted to bring an end to this and hence Amrita Repository was developed. It started off as a Python CLI application providing access to only question papers which later extended itself to an android app and a telegram bot with much more helpful features.

item.title: Farewell at Internshala
item.description: Today was my last working day at Internshala and guess what! They sent me this picture as a farewell gesture! Looks amazing, isn’t it ? :D Internshala is a technology company on a mission to equip students with relevant skills & practical exposure through internships and online trainings. Back in June 2018, when I was in my summer vacation after first year at college, all I knew was C and C++.

item.title: About
item.description: I am Rajkumar, an ambitious software engineer, ever in awe of the wonders that 0s & 1s could create. I started my development with mainly Android apps made out of Java, then got to explore web technologies such as Laravel, NodeJS, Angular etc. The software I mostly use are : Jetbrains suite of IDEs for development. Sublime Text for quick text editing. Sublime Merge for complex git stuff. Duckduckgo mostly, Startpage rarely.
